### PR summary [0c7ff929a2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18054/commits/0c7ff929a2c57b520fbf09acd4bdf0785b02a89b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Semisimple`|1726|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ inf_mem`
`+ isFinitelySemisimple`
`+ orthogonalComplement_mem_invtSubmodule`
`+ sup_mem`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11636626151/job/32408375951)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11636626151/job/32408376267)
I was wondering why we needed this, and then I found out that we have no `SublatticeClass` :scream: Obviously it's not something that should be handled in this PR.
Yep. Actually sublattices arrived amazingly late to Mathlib and there is still a bunch of stuff missing (including structures for sublattices containing top and / or bottom).

Can you do the versions of this and the following lemma for `IsStarNormal T` too? Unfortunately, because we don't have an adjoint all the time, here you really will need to restrict to finite dimensional subspaces, and/or to *continuous* linear maps on Hilbert spaces (but for the latter we should probably have a `IsTopologicallySemisimple` predicate, or something to that effect; so if you want to hold off on the continuous ones, that's fine).

The other option would be to phrase it in terms of a commuting `LinearMap.IsAdjointPair`, but even that would require glue to get back to `IsStarNormal` (which I think we don't have currently).

For the second day in a row, I've run out of time to implement this suggestion so I'll just say I agree it is worth adding up a version of this for normal operators: they should also be finitely semisimple.

I think it will be a tiny bit of work to prove the key result that for a normal operator in finite dimensions, the orthogonal complement of an invariant subspace is invariant (without using the spectral theorem) but I hope to get to this at the weekend.

I finally had a chance to look into this properly and it seems to me that generalising to normal operators will require a bit of detour. To be precise, the following is the result which I understand you have in mind:
```lean
lemma ContinuousLinearMap.isFinitelySemisimple_of_isStarNormal
    {T : E →L[𝕜] E} [CompleteSpace E] (hT : IsStarNormal T) :
    Module.End.IsFinitelySemisimple (T : Module.End 𝕜 E) :=
  sorry
```
This follows trivially from:
```lean
lemma LinearMap.orthogonalComplement_mem_invtSubmodule [FiniteDimensional 𝕜 E]
    {p : Submodule 𝕜 E} {T : Module.End 𝕜 E} (hT : IsStarNormal T)
    (hp : p ∈ T.invtSubmodule) :
    pᗮ ∈ T.invtSubmodule :=
  sorry
```
This latter result is easy but the best proof I can find (in fact [on Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Normal_operator#Properties_in_finite-dimensional_case)) requires the inner product structure on linear maps. Specifically, we seem to lack the following:
```lean
variable {F : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup F] [InnerProductSpace 𝕜 F]

open InnerProductSpace InnerProduct

noncomputable instance [FiniteDimensional 𝕜 E] [FiniteDimensional 𝕜 F] :
    Inner 𝕜 (E →L[𝕜] F) where
  inner T S :=
    let _i : CompleteSpace E := FiniteDimensional.complete 𝕜 E
    let _i : CompleteSpace F := FiniteDimensional.complete 𝕜 F
    LinearMap.trace 𝕜 E ((T†).comp S)

instance [FiniteDimensional 𝕜 E] [FiniteDimensional 𝕜 F] :
    InnerProductSpace 𝕜 (E →L[𝕜] F) :=
  sorry
```
This would all be easy to put in place but it's quite a detour.

More generally one should really be assuming compactness instead of finite-dimensionality, i.e.:
```lean
lemma ContinuousLinearMap.orthogonalComplement_mem_invtSubmodule [CompleteSpace E]
    {p : Submodule 𝕜 E} {T : E →L[𝕜] E} (hT : IsStarNormal T) (hT' : IsCompactOperator T)
    (hp : p ∈ Module.End.invtSubmodule T) :
    pᗮ ∈ Module.End.invtSubmodule T :=
  sorry
```
but then this would require some non-trivial work.

So it seems to me there is a nice small project to be done before we are ready for this result. However I don't spend much time in this corner of the library. What do you think?
I think there's a more elementary proof IIRC. I'll try to write it down later today, but today is my big teaching day.

Unfortunately, the proof I was thinking of establishes a different fact, so it doesn't work here. It would be nice to eventually get the Wold decomposition into Mathlib, but that's for another day, and only tangentially related to this. In any case, let's just skip the normal result for now.

```suggestion
  · suffices q ⊔ qᗮ = ⊤ by rw [← sup_inf_assoc_of_le _ hq₂, this, top_inf_eq p]
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: symmetric operators are finitely-semisimple

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Analysis.InnerProductSpace): Decomposition of finite-dimensional inner product space as direct sum of joint eigenspaces of commuting finite tuples of symmetric operators
